net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver
Interface iSelectorHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
iReadableSelectorHandler, iWritableSelectorHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
AcceptableSelectorHandler, GatheringWritableSelectorHandler, ReadableSelectorHandler
public interface iSelectorHandler

Implementations of this interfact have a Selector that must be created at startup.

In most cases, it is the sub-interfaces that are most interesting

See Also:
iResponseWriter, iReadableSelectorHandler, AcceptaleSelectorHandler, GatheringWritableSelectorHandler, FourThreadWebserver

Method Summary
 java.nio.channels.Selector createSelector()
          In most situations, any IOException during this method means a System.exit() is necessary - but it's far too dangerous to do that by default, so implementations are expected to re-throw any IOException's even if they catch them, unless they can take appropriate behaviour to fix the problem
 void start()
           
 

Method Detail

createSelector

public java.nio.channels.Selector createSelector()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
In most situations, any IOException during this method means a System.exit() is necessary - but it's far too dangerous to do that by default, so implementations are expected to re-throw any IOException's even if they catch them, unless they can take appropriate behaviour to fix the problem
